item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“Miles`, post:20, topic:396054”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=493234.msg3607550#msg3607550 date=1306260239]

[quote author=Miles` link=topic=493234.msg3607527#msg3607527 date=1306256846]

Oh my God.

That pop up wasn’t an official Java Popup, was it?
[/quote]by starting any applet you are running an .exe

What?
[/quote]the no option probably was the same selection as yes

no?? you are an idiot, the applet needs to be signed to have access to anything on the computer. the prompt that came up was it asking if you wanted to accept the signature, saying no will have stopped it from downloading shit etc.

@Anthony, the applet doesn’t need to be signed with a legit program. Ever heard of Java Drive By?

I was under the impression java drivebys still needed your permission to work. Also hurr durr anything unsigned needs your permission to work.

Anything you run needs permission whether it’s signed or unsigned. Hurr Durrr and whether you choose to run the application or not you still get infected.
@Anthony Then learn some common fucking sense and learn that anyone can script something to say it’s signed by a legit program, and whether or not it’s authenticated isn’t the fucking point. And i’m not a skiddie, you illiterate cunt.[/quote]
So you’re telling me if I don’t give it permission to run, I’m still infected. Yep, very fucking smart, you retard.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

[quote=“n10si t, post:22, topic:396054”]first off, i’m not the best with programming so please correct me if im wrong. I’ll use rsps in my example.

So say you have an unsigned webclient on a page. unsigned, so it wouldnt run, like anthony stated. then perhaps in the websites html, you could call up an .exe, (could you do it through html?), and have it create a small gui that looks like the java signing gui. and have it to where no matter what button you clicked you got the virus. it would look like it happened through java, but it didnt.

this is just a theory btw.[/quote]
nope, the web browser would be restricted from running any kind of executable, and you can’t even do anything like that with HTML because it is nothing more than a markup language.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“n10si t, post:22, topic:396054”]first off, i’m not the best with programming so please correct me if im wrong. I’ll use rsps in my example.

So say you have an unsigned webclient on a page. unsigned, so it wouldnt run, like anthony stated. then perhaps in the websites html, you could call up an .exe, (could you do it through html?), and have it create a small gui that looks like the java signing gui. and have it to where no matter what button you clicked you got the virus. it would look like it happened through java, but it didnt.

this is just a theory btw.[/quote]Sounds like it would work.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @n10si_t n10si t
item.description:
@n10si_t wrote:

first off, i’m not the best with programming so please correct me if im wrong. I’ll use rsps in my example.

So say you have an unsigned webclient on a page. unsigned, so it wouldnt run, like anthony stated. then perhaps in the websites html, you could call up an .exe, (could you do it through html?), and have it create a small gui that looks like the java signing gui. and have it to where no matter what button you clicked you got the virus. it would look like it happened through java, but it didnt.

this is just a theory btw.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

[quote=“Miles`, post:20, topic:396054”][quote author=ytuio9 link=topic=493234.msg3607550#msg3607550 date=1306260239]

[quote author=Miles` link=topic=493234.msg3607527#msg3607527 date=1306256846]

Oh my God.

That pop up wasn’t an official Java Popup, was it?
[/quote]by starting any applet you are running an .exe

What?
[/quote]the no option probably was the same selection as yes

no?? you are an idiot, the applet needs to be signed to have access to anything on the computer. the prompt that came up was it asking if you wanted to accept the signature, saying no will have stopped it from downloading shit etc.

@Anthony, the applet doesn’t need to be signed with a legit program. Ever heard of Java Drive By?

I was under the impression java drivebys still needed your permission to work. Also hurr durr anything unsigned needs your permission to work.

Anything you run needs permission whether it’s signed or unsigned. Hurr Durrr and whether you choose to run the application or not you still get infected.
@Anthony Then learn some common fucking sense and learn that anyone can script something to say it’s signed by a legit program, and whether or not it’s authenticated isn’t the fucking point. And i’m not a skiddie, you illiterate cunt.[/quote]
if it isn’t signed it wouldn’t ask permission it just wouldn’t fucking run, learn how the JVM works you fucking moron. there is no "unlegit’ way to sign a fucking java applet, the jdk comes with a signing tool and you just use it, dumbass.
seeing as java drive-by is something that was coined by some stupid faggot on hackforums (which is a site full of moronic teenage skiddies like yourself), you are a fucking skiddie.

side note: do you even understand the concept of illiteracy?

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

Norton really is very bad. I’m hovering between Avira, Avast and malwarebytes currently, but all three are pretty good. avira is pretty fast but Avast is better when it comes to operating in the background. Malwarebytes is like the jack of all trades, but I haven’t really used it that much to judge it properly.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

i use spybot search and destroy, and also malwarebytes, they both do a better job than norton 360, good thing i dont pay for norton and comcast does or i would be pissed. norton is pretty much crap. i heard of a virus like that that some how exploits javas security measures. idk if it really does or if ppl getting infected by it really dont know they actually got themselves infected.

like u can use java and javascript interactively, idk if mixing them together would make it were a signed applet would have access to ur computer(meaning having a javascript thing make it where it allows the java applet to have access). this is a like to a similar virus that i was talking about idk if its the exact one im talking about: http://www.bleepingcomputer.com/virus-removal/remove-fake-microsoft-security-essentials-alert

hey that page mentions defender.exe so idk if that will have info for u or not.

Read full topic

What?
[/quote]the no option probably was the same selection as yes

no?? you are an idiot, the applet needs to be signed to have access to anything on the computer. the prompt that came up was it asking if you wanted to accept the signature, saying no will have stopped it from downloading shit etc.

@cole you were probably infected before that pop-up shit and just bad timing. some common registry entries you are going to want to look at are the Proxy related ones, the startup ones, and then you should probably clear the winsock catalog to ensure they didn’t do some sort of LSP.
[/quote]Hmm well if it was an applet couldn’t you had still viewed the page source?[/quote]
what would that do…
